definitions.definition: unusually great intelligence, skill or artistic ability

examples.text: Her idea was **a stroke of genius**.
In a flash of pure genius, she realized the answer to the problem.
She was at the peak of her creative genius.
a work which shows real genius
He was a man of great genius.
It's undoubtedly a work of genius.

definitions.definition: a person who is unusually intelligent or artistic, or who has a very high level of skill, especially in one area

examples.text: He's a genius at organizing people.
You don't have to be a genius to see that they are in love!
He was undoubtedly the greatest comic genius of his age.
Some people say that there is only ever one true genius born in each generation.
He had a genius for making people feel at home.
She has a genius for sorting things out.
his genius for pinpointing the absurd

definitions.definition: a person or spirit who is thought to have a good/bad influence over you

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin, ‘attendant spirit present from one's birth, innate ability or inclination’, from the root of gignere ‘beget’. The original sense ‘spirit attendant on a person’ gave rise to a sense ‘a person's characteristic disposition’ (late 16th cent.), which led to a sense ‘a person's natural ability’, and finally ‘exceptional natural ability’ (mid 17th cent.).
